questions.answer: E. misconfiguring the metric-type option in the redistribute command to type-2.

choices.B: missing the subnet option in the redistribute command.
choices.A: missing the tag option in the redistribute command.
choices.D: misconfiguring the metric-type option in the redistribute command to type-1.
choices.C: missing the metric option in the redistribute command.

questions.question_text: When other routing protocol routes are being redistributed into OSPF, what is one of the most common problems?

discussion.content: B. missing the subnet option in the redistribute command.

questions.answer_ET: E. misconfiguring the metric-type option in the redistribute command to type-2.
questions.answer_description: The point of this question is about the redistribution of OSPF. To redistribute routes from one routing domain into another routing domain, use the redistribute command in router configuration mode. redistribute protocol [process-id] {level- 1 | level-1-2 | level-2} [as-number] [metric {metric-value | transparent}] [metric-type type- value] [match {internal | external 1 | external 2}] [tag tag-value] [route-map map-tag] [subnets] The subnets keyword tells OSPF to redistribute all subnet routes. Without the subnets keyword, only networks that are not subnetted are redistributed by OSPF.

choices.D: On all Area 3 routers router ospf 10 area 3 stub
choices.C: On all Area 3 routers router ospf 10 area 3 stub no-summary
choices.A: On the ABR router ospf 10 area 3 nssa
choices.B: On the ABR router ospf 10 area 3 stub

discussion.content:
On the ABR
router ospf 10
area 3 stub no-summary

questions.question_text:
Refer to the diagram. Which OSPF configuration command is required to configure Area 3 as a totally stubby area?
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Explanation -
To make an area totally stubby we must apply the area area-id stub no-summary command on the ABR (the middle router in this case) and area area-id stub commands to all other routers in that area.

Explanation -
The show ip ospf database external command displays information only about external LSAs (Type 5 LSAs).
Below is an example of the show ip ospf database external command
Notice the line LS Type: AS External Link, which means LSA Type 5. For your information, the Link State ID: 143.105.0.0 indicates the network being advertised; the Advertising Router: 10.187.70.6 indicates the router that originated this LSA.
Note:
+ The show ip ospf database summary command displays information only about the summary LSAs.
+ The show ip ospf database nssa-external command displays information only about the not so stubby area (NSSA) external LSAs.

discussion.content: A. show ip ospf database external

questions.question_text: Which show command will display only the Type 5 LSAs in the OSPF topology database?
Which condition must be met before a router can send an ICMP redirect message?

discussion.content:
One more explanation:
ICMP messages are generated when a packet enters and exits the same router interface.

choices.D: ICMP echo requests must have been disabled globally.
choices.B: The ingress and egress interfaces on the device must be different.
choices.A: The IP address of the sending device must be in the same subnet as the next hop.
